project_specific_ipynb_code.reduced_model_output_paper.ReducedModel¶

class project_specific_ipynb_code.reduced_model_output_paper.ReducedModel(kernel_dict, LUT, ISI_penalty, spatial_bin_size=50)[source]¶

Bases: object

__init__(kernel_dict, LUT, ISI_penalty, spatial_bin_size=50)[source]¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

Methods

__init__(kernel_dict, LUT, ISI_penalty[, …])

Initialize self.

get_spatial_bin_by_soma_dist(soma_dist)

run(SAexc, SAinh[, return_WNI, tStop, WNI_path])

Apply the reduced model to synaptic input to get a list containing output spike times. SAexc, SAinh: numpy arrays containing spatiotemporally binned synaptic inputs return_WNI: False, ‘EI_balance’ or ‘full_trace’ full_trace returns a dataframe containing excitatory and inhibitory WNI values at all timepoints along with spike times. EI_balance returns a dictionary containing the mean excitatory, inhibitory and total WNI value for the whole simulation False returns spike times list only. tStop: int.
run(SAexc, SAinh, return_WNI=False, tStop=300, WNI_path=None)[source]¶

Apply the reduced model to synaptic input to get a list containing output spike times. SAexc, SAinh: numpy arrays containing spatiotemporally binned synaptic inputs return_WNI: False, ‘EI_balance’ or ‘full_trace’

full_trace returns a dataframe containing excitatory and inhibitory WNI values at all timepoints along with spike times. EI_balance returns a dictionary containing the mean excitatory, inhibitory and total WNI value for the whole simulation False returns spike times list only.

tStop: int
